segment.source: How to Manually Add an Application
segment.target: How to Manually Add an Application

segment.source: How to Manually Add an Application
segment.target: How to Manually Add an Application

segment.source: How to Manually Add an Application
segment.target: How to Manually Add an Application

segment.source: When adding an application to the Application Virtualization Management Server, it is recommended that you import it.
segment.target: When adding an application to the Application Virtualization Management Server, it is recommended that you import it.

segment.source: You can add an application manually, but you must provide the precise, detailed information about the application called for in this section.
segment.target: You can add an application manually, but you must provide the precise, detailed information about the application called for in this section.

segment.source: To manually add a new application
segment.target: To manually add a new application

segment.source: In the left pane, right-click the Applications node and choose New Application.
segment.target: In the left pane, right-click the Applications node and choose New Application.

segment.source: In the New Application Wizard, complete the General Information dialog box:
segment.target: In the New Application Wizard, complete the General Information dialog box:

segment.source: Application Name—Type the name you want the users to see.
segment.target: Application Name—Type the name you want the users to see.

segment.source: Version—Type the application version.
segment.target: Version—Type the application version.

segment.source: Enabled—This box must be selected to stream the application after you create it.
segment.target: Enabled—This box must be selected to stream the application after you create it.

segment.source: Description—Type an optional description for administrative use.
segment.target: Description—Type an optional description for administrative use.

segment.source: OSD Path—Browse the network to the application's Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file.
segment.target: OSD Path—Browse the network to the application's Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file.

segment.source: This file must be in a shared network folder.
segment.target: This file must be in a shared network folder.

segment.source: Icon Path—Browse to the application's ICO file.
segment.target: Icon Path—Browse to the application's ICO file.

segment.source: Application License Group—If you have set up license groups, you can assign the application to one by selecting it in the pull-down list.
segment.target: Application License Group—If you have set up license groups, you can assign the application to one by selecting it in the pull-down list.

segment.source: Server Group—If you have multiple Application Virtualization Servers, you can assign the application to one by selecting it in the pull-down list.
segment.target: Server Group—If you have multiple Application Virtualization Servers, you can assign the application to one by selecting it in the pull-down list.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: In the Select Package dialog box, select the related package and click Next.
segment.target: In the Select Package dialog box, select the related package and click Next.

segment.source: On the Published Shortcuts screen, select the boxes for the locations where you would like the application shortcuts to appear on the client computers and click Next.
segment.target: On the Published Shortcuts screen, select the boxes for the locations where you would like the application shortcuts to appear on the client computers and click Next.

segment.source: In the File Associations screen, you can add new type file associations to this application.
segment.target: In the File Associations screen, you can add new type file associations to this application.

segment.source: To do so, click Add, enter the extension (without a preceding dot), enter a description, and click OK.
segment.target: To do so, click Add, enter the extension (without a preceding dot), enter a description, and click OK.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: In the Access Permissions dialog box, click Add.
segment.target: In the Access Permissions dialog box, click Add.

segment.source: In the Add/Edit User Group dialog box, navigate to the user group.
segment.target: In the Add/Edit User Group dialog box, navigate to the user group.

segment.source: You can also enter the domain and group by typing the information in the respective fields.
segment.target: You can also enter the domain and group by typing the information in the respective fields.

segment.source: When you finish, click OK.
segment.target: When you finish, click OK.

segment.source: You can add other groups with the same pages.
segment.target: You can add other groups with the same pages.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Summary screen, you can review the import settings.
segment.target: On the Summary screen, you can review the import settings.

segment.source: Click Finish to add the application, click Back to change the information, or click Cancel.
segment.target: Click Finish to add the application, click Back to change the information, or click Cancel.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: How to Manage Applications in the Server Management Console
segment.target: How to Manage Applications in the Server Management Console
